message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.SD 

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it proposes a method for learning hard attention models using variational inference. It also involves training a model on a sequential task, which is a common problem in machine learning. Additionally, the paper may also belong to cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.CV (Computer Vision) as hard attention models have been used in tasks such as visual captioning and speech recognition. The paper may also be relevant to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as it involves developing a method for improving the performance of a machine learning model. Finally, the paper may also be relevant to cs.SD (Sound) as it involves a phoneme recognition task in noisy environments.
